Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.08, <0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.08, <0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Melanie Lynn Alvarez Larison was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Melanie Lynn Alvarez Larison was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.

Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Count 1

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the C.J. (person, property, residence or family). Obtain a stable residence. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Probation maybe transfered to Illinois, West Virginia or another state if approved by DOC.

Count 1- 6 Months RCJ, CFTS, $700 fine + cc, 2 Years DLR, AODA assessment, 2 Years IID, payment plan of $50 a month starting February 1, 2017, ftp 30 days

Count 2- 5 Years WPS, 2 Years ic, 3 Years es, to run consecutive to count 1, i/s, 3 Years Probation

No drugs, no alcohol
AODA assessment
No contact with C.J.

FAW
VOTE
